intro: Mercurialis perennis f. genuina, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mercury. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, alternate leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers with four petals, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wet meadows and stream banks. Due to its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
